content:
ToolStripDropDownItem Class

Definition

Provides basic functionality for controls that display a ToolStripDropDown when a ToolStripDropDownButton, ToolStripMenuItem, or ToolStripSplitButton control is clicked.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.DefaultProperty("DropDownItems")]
[System.ComponentModel.Designer("System.Windows.Forms.Design.ToolStripMenuItemDesigner, System.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")]
public abstract class ToolStripDropDownItem : System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem

Remarks

ToolStripDropDownItem is the abstract base class for ToolStripMenuItem, ToolStripDropDownButton, and ToolStripSplitButton, which can host items directly or host additional items in a drop-down container. You do this by setting the DropDown property to a ToolStripDropDown and setting the Items property of the ToolStripDropDown. Access these drop-down items directly through the DropDownItems property.

Constructors

ToolStripDropDownItem()

Initializes a new instance of the ToolStripDropDownItem class.

protected ToolStripDropDownItem ();

Remarks

You must derive a drop-down control from the ToolStripDropDownItem class in order to have any drop-down functionality for a ToolStripDropDownButton, ToolStripMenuItem, or ToolStripSplitButton control.

ToolStripDropDownItem(String,Image,EventHandler)

Initializes a new instance of the ToolStripDropDownItem class with the specified display text, image, and action to take when the drop-down control is clicked.

protected ToolStripDropDownItem (string text, System.Drawing.Image image, EventHandler onClick);
text
String

The display text of the drop-down control.

image
Image

The Image to be displayed on the control.

onClick
EventHandler

The action to take when the drop-down control is clicked.

Remarks

You must derive a drop-down control from the ToolStripDropDownItem class in order to have any drop-down functionality for a ToolStripDropDownButton, ToolStripMenuItem, or ToolStripSplitButton control.

ToolStripDropDownItem(String,Image,ToolStripItem[])

Initializes a new instance of the ToolStripDropDownItem class with the specified display text, image, and ToolStripItem collection that the drop-down control contains.

protected ToolStripDropDownItem (string text, System.Drawing.Image image, System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem[] dropDownItems);
text
String

The display text of the drop-down control.

image
Image

The Image to be displayed on the control.

dropDownItems
ToolStripItem[]

A ToolStripItem collection that the drop-down control contains.

Remarks

You must derive a drop-down control from the ToolStripDropDownItem class in order to have any drop-down functionality for a ToolStripDropDownButton, ToolStripMenuItem, or ToolStripSplitButton control.

ToolStripDropDownItem(String,Image,EventHandler,String)

Initializes a new instance of the ToolStripDropDownItem class with the specified display text, image, action to take when the drop-down control is clicked, and control name.

protected ToolStripDropDownItem (string text, System.Drawing.Image image, EventHandler onClick, string name);
text
String

The display text of the drop-down control.

image
Image

The Image to be displayed on the control.

onClick
EventHandler

The action to take when the drop-down control is clicked.

name
String

The name of the control.

Properties

DropDown

Gets or sets the ToolStripDropDown that will be displayed when this ToolStripDropDownItem is clicked.

public System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown DropDown { get; set; }
Value
ToolStripDropDown

A ToolStripDropDown that is associated with the ToolStripDropDownItem.

Remarks

If no ToolStripDropDown is associated with the ToolStripDropDownItem, a call to CreateDefaultDropDown creates a generic drop-down control.

Note

If a drop-down control is automatically generated, which means that items are added to the collection, and you then set the DropDown property to an explicit drop-down control, you might lose data.

DropDownDirection

Gets or sets a value indicating the direction in which the ToolStripDropDownItem emerges from its parent container.

public System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownDirection DropDownDirection { get; set; }
Value
ToolStripDropDownDirection

One of the ToolStripDropDownDirection values.

Exceptions
InvalidEnumArgumentException

The property is set to a value that is not one of the ToolStripDropDownDirection values.

DropDownItems

Gets the collection of items in the ToolStripDropDown that is associated with this ToolStripDropDownItem.

public System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection DropDownItems { get; }
Value
ToolStripItemCollection

A ToolStripItemCollection of controls.

Remarks

Use the DropDownItems property to get all the items in the ToolStripDropDown that is referred to by the DropDown property.

DropDownLocation

Gets the screen coordinates, in pixels, of the upper-left corner of the ToolStripDropDownItem.

protected virtual System.Drawing.Point DropDownLocation { get; }
Value
Point

A Point representing the x and y screen coordinates, in pixels.

HasDropDown

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the stem.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.DropDown* for the ToolStripDropDownItem has been created.

public bool HasDropDown { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the stem.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.DropDown* for the ToolStripDropDownItem has been created otherwise, false.

HasDropDownItems

Gets a value indicating whether the ToolStripDropDownItem has ToolStripDropDown controls associated with it.

public virtual bool HasDropDownItems { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the ToolStripDropDownItem has ToolStripDropDown controls; otherwise, false.

Pressed

Gets a value indicating whether the ToolStripDropDownItem is in the pressed state.

public override bool Pressed { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the ToolStripDropDownItem is in the pressed state; otherwise, false.

Methods

CreateAccessibilityInstance()

Creates a new accessibility object for the ToolStripItem.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject CreateAccessibilityInstance ();
Returns
AccessibleObject

A new AccessibleObject for the ToolStripItem.

CreateDefaultDropDown()

Creates a generic ToolStripDropDown for which events can be defined.

protected virtual System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown CreateDefaultDropDown ();
Returns
ToolStripDropDown

The created ToolStripDropDown object.

Remarks

The CreateDefaultDropDown method is automatically called if the DropDown property finds no ToolStripDropDown associated with the ToolStripDropDownItem.

Dispose(Boolean)

Releases the unmanaged resources used by the ToolStripDropDownItem and optionally releases the managed resources.

protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);
disposing
Boolean

true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

Remarks

This method is called by the public Dispose()method and the Finalize method. Dispose() invokes the protected Dispose(Boolean) method with the disposing parameter set to true. Finalize invokes Dispose with disposing set to false.

When the disposing parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this ToolStripDropDownItem references. This method invokes the Dispose() method of each referenced object.

HideDropDown()

Makes a visible ToolStripDropDown hidden.

public void HideDropDown ();

Remarks

Use the HideDropDown method to prevent the user from choosing one of the options available on the associated ToolStripDropDown control.

OnBoundsChanged()

Occurs when the stem.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Bounds* property changes.

protected override void OnBoundsChanged ();

OnDropDownClosed(EventArgs)

Raises the DropDownClosed event.

protected virtual void OnDropDownClosed (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnDropDownClosed method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnDropDownHide(EventArgs)

Raised in response to the stem.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.HideDropDown* method.

protected virtual void OnDropDownHide (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnDropDownHide method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnDropDownItemClicked(ToolStripItemClickedEventArgs)

Raises the DropDownItemClicked event.

protected virtual void OnDropDownItemClicked (System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemClickedEventArgs e);
e
ToolStripItemClickedEventArgs

A ToolStripItemClickedEventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnDropDownItemClicked method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnDropDownOpened(EventArgs)

Raises the DropDownOpened event.

protected virtual void OnDropDownOpened (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnDropDownOpened method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnDropDownShow(EventArgs)

Raised in response to the stem.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.ShowDropDown* method.

protected virtual void OnDropDownShow (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnDropDownShow method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnFontChanged(EventArgs)

Raises the FontChanged event.

protected override void OnFontChanged (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnFontChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnRightToLeftChanged(EventArgs)

Raises the RightToLeftChanged event.

protected override void OnRightToLeftChanged (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

ProcessCmdKey(Message,Keys)

Processes a command key.

protected override bool ProcessCmdKey (ref System.Windows.Forms.Message m, System.Windows.Forms.Keys keyData);
m
Message

A Message, passed by reference, that represents the window message to process.

keyData
Keys

One of the Keys values that represents the key to process.

Returns
Boolean

false in all cases.

Remarks

This method is called during message preprocessing to handle command keys. Command keys are keys that always take precedence over regular input keys. Examples of command keys include accelerators and menu shortcuts. The method must return true to indicate that it has processed the command key, or false to indicate that the key is not a command key.

The ToolStripDropDownItem implementation of this method calls the ProcessCmdKey of the DropDown if there are items in the DropDownItems collection. Otherwise, this implementation calls the base class implementation.

ProcessDialogKey(Keys)

Processes a dialog key.

protected override bool ProcessDialogKey (System.Windows.Forms.Keys keyData);
keyData
Keys

One of the Keys values that represents the key to process.

Returns
Boolean

true if the key was processed by the item; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This method is called during message preprocessing to handle the UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, ENTER, and SPACEBAR keys in order to navigate the hierarchy of drop-down menus.

ShowDropDown()

Displays the ToolStripDropDownItem control associated with this ToolStripDropDownItem.

public void ShowDropDown ();
Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The ToolStripDropDownItem is the same as the parent ToolStrip.

Remarks

Use the ShowDropDown method to display the drop-down controls that have been set by the DropDown property.

Events

DropDownClosed

Occurs when the ToolStripDropDown closes.

public event EventHandler DropDownClosed;

Remarks

For more information about handling events, see Events.

DropDownItemClicked

Occurs when the ToolStripDropDown is clicked.

public event System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemClickedEventHandler DropDownItemClicked;

Remarks

For more information about handling events, see Events.

DropDownOpened

Occurs when the ToolStripDropDown has opened.

public event EventHandler DropDownOpened;

Remarks

This event occurs when the user clicks the drop down item or when you call the ShowDropDown method. You can use this event to dynamically populate the ToolStripDropDown.

For more information about handling events, see Events.

DropDownOpening

Occurs as the ToolStripDropDown is opening.

public event EventHandler DropDownOpening;

Remarks

For more information about handling events, see Events.
